abstract_summ: In this study, using a modified SIR (Susceptible-Infected-Recovered) model a forecast is generated to predict the trends of COVID-19 cases in Bangladesh.In this paper, we review the latest models for analyzing COVID19 related data, conduct post-publication model evaluations and cross-model comparisons, and collect data sources from different projects.In this research, we studied the trend, model Nigeria daily COVID-19 cases and forecast for the future occurrences in the country at large.Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has been considered as a global threat infectious disease, and various mathematical models are being used to conduct multiple studies to analyze and predict the evolution of this epidemic.Forecast for 30 days was then made for COVID-19 cases in Nigeria.
title_summ: A mathematical model for the spatiotemporal epidemic spreading of COVID19Spreading Analysis of COVID-19 Epidemic in Bangladesh by Dynamical Mathematical ModellingModelling the Occurrence of the Novel Pandemic COVID-19 Outbreak; A Box and Jenkins ApproachA Method to Model Outbreaks of New Infectious Diseases with Pandemic Potential such as COVID-19Mathematical Analysis of a COVID-19 Epidemic Model by using Data Driven Epidemiological Parameters of Diseases Spread in IndiaBrief Analysis of the ARIMA model on the COVID-19 in ItalyAnalyses and Forecast for COVID-19 epidemic in IndiaData-driven Analytical Models of COVID-2019 for Epidemic Prediction, Clinical Diagnosis, Policy Effectiveness and Contact Tracing: A SurveyD(2)EA: Depict the Epidemic Picture of COVID-19
title_abstract_phrases: Brief Analysis of the ARIMA model on the COVID-19 in ItalyCoronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) has been considered as a global threat infectious disease, and various mathematical models are being used to conduct multiple studies to analyze and predict the evolution of this epidemic.In this research, we studied the trend, model Nigeria daily COVID-19 cases and forecast for the future occurrences in the country at large.Modelling the Occurrence of the Novel Pandemic COVID-19 Outbreak; A Box and Jenkins ApproachThe corona virus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a novel pandemic disease that spreads very fast and causes severe respiratory problem to its carrier and thereby results to death in some cases.In this paper, we review the latest models for analyzing COVID19 related data, conduct post-publication model evaluations and cross-model comparisons, and collect data sources from different projects.We also compared India's position in containing the disease with two countries with higher and lower number of infections than India and show the early imposition of lockdown has reduced the number of infected cases significantly.
